page.title: 04A Hedgerow By The Mill
page.content: Ten of us went to study the hedgerow by the mill. We decided to study a thirty metre stretch. We counted the trees. There were hawthorn, sycamore, elm, hazel, elder and dogwood. We found dogroses, cowparsley, thistles, buttercups, white clover, red campion, forget_me_not, goosegrass, nettles, Lords_and_Ladies, different kinds of grasses and a puff ball, all growing in the thirty metre stretch. I saw a butterfly which I thought was a red admiral. Some people found ladybirds and flies. We saw some aphids on a sorrel dock plant being guarded by ants. If we kept quiet we could hear a lot of birds. We saw house martins, swallows, chaffinches, blackbirds, crows ,swifts, starlings and, on the way back, we saw some long_tailed tits. The weather was sunny and hot that day.
